The pilgrimage of hundreds of Catholic followers to a hill in the north has ended in tragedy. At least six civilians were shot dead and at least 35 injured in clashes with police, responsible for preventing access to this forbidden hill.

A armed group part of the FNL attacked a bus of civilians coming from Bujumbura
Clashes between polices forces and young rioters over the expulsion of a family in order to give the house to a Hutu family

To dislodge them, the police resorted to tear gas, but the students responded by throwing stones, which prompted police to shoot live bullets in the air.
Gunmen in Burundi killed three people and seriously wounded two others when they opened fire in a crowded bar and exploded a grenade

Supporters of Pierre-Claver Mbonimpa, president of the main human rights organization in Burundi, demonstrated outside the court in Bujumbura where he is being tried for ""endangering state security""

It is unclear whether there were clashes between the groups or if the injuries were from the police trying to break up the gathering.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The house of UPRONA supporter was attacked by Imbonerakure members.

2 Italian nuns were murdered (and allegedly raped but this was disputed by the convent leadership) in their convent by a Burundian allegedly related to a land dispute because the parish had been built on land owned by his parents. Religious motives are also suspected due to the methods of murder and indignities done to the bodies.
A 3rd Italian nun was killed at a convent near Kamenge, and decapitated. It is not certain whether the same person killed all three or if an accomplice killed the 3rd.

column7: OLUCOME: Anti-Corruption and Economic Malpractice Observatory
column17: The head of OLUCOME engaged in a solo-protest against corruption (as mass demonstrations have been made illegal), but was stopped before he could arrive at the offices of the justice and interior ministeries by a dozen police officers who took him home, allegedly to avoid the publicity of putting another well-known civil society activist in prison.
FNL rebels claim to have killed 6 soldiers and lost 1 of their own fighters during an attack on army positions in Gihanga, just 20 miles north of Bujumbura, before retreating into the Rukoko marshes.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: A known pro-FNL Rwasa activist was shot and died of his wounds. The identity of the murder is unknown but the attack is believed to have been politically motivated.

Burundian returnees from Tanzania engaged in a 3-day sit-in in front of the Ministry of National Solidarity to demand attention to their grievances. They dispersed after being told their situations would be examined by the department.

Residents of Ndebe hill in Gitega erected barricades on the Gitega-Ngozi road to demand allowances which have not been disbursed since the road was built. The administrator of the municpality promised to compensate them and the barricade was cleared.
On or around 15 October 2014, residents of Gisuru caught two alleged robbers and killed them with machetes and sticks.

Medical residents demonstrated outside the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research to demand ""financial support from the ministry until the end of their curriculum"".

On 14 December 2014, a taxi driver was attacked by men with machetes after he dropped off a journalist in Kanyosha. It was reportedly claimed that the men believed the journalist was still in the cab, and that the attack was motivated by the victim's profession.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

The home of Burundis Minister of Public Health and the Fight Against AIDS was the target of a grenade attack which damaged vehicle but caused no injuries.
Supporters rallied outside Mpimba central prison in Bujumbura following rumours that the former leader of the CNDD-FDD party would be pardoned. Police arrested some of the people who gathered.

4 people were seriously injured in a clash over a land dispute between young people from the Gatumba and Rukaramu areas. Police arrived and fired into the air several times to disperse the two groups who were fighting with machetes.
People from Gatumba and Rukaramu clashed for the second time in a week following a land dispute. People from Gatumba barricaded a main road to protest, leading to the new clashes.

RPA reported that around 200 unidentified gunmen attacked a military position in Murwi, with fighting lasting from Dec.30-31. At least 35 people have been killed, including 34 attackers and 1 soldiers. RPA also reported 1 civilian death.

RPA reported that around 200 unidentified gunmen attacked a military position in Murwi, with fighting lasting from Dec.30-31. At least 35 people have been killed, including 34 attackers and 1 soldiers. RPA also reported 1 civilian death.
Followers of Euzebie, ""who claims to have seen divine apparations"", engaged in a ""scuffle"" with police, leading to at least 62 arrests. 6 police were injured during the fight.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Fighting between unidentified attackers believed to be from the DRC and the Burundian army as well as associated paramilitary forces, including the Imbonerakure (from Jan.1-2), between Dec.30-Jan.2 has resulted in between 99 total deaths, with 95 attackers killed and 9 captured by Burundian military forces, 2 Burundian soldiers killed, and 2 civilians dead. RPA reports that some of the attackers have been executed after surrendering their weapons by suspected Imbonerakure youths, although the government has denied this.

Several hundred people demonstrated in front of the Embassy of France in solidarity with the people of France following the Charlie Hebdo attack.
Around 2,000 people demonstrated in favor of the countries security forces; some may have been paid by the government to participate. Opposition parties did not take part.
A protest was held in front of the courthouse where a trial took place against Bob Rugurika, the director of the RPA Radio Station

Almost 30 people people demonstrated against Bob Rugurika, the African Public Radio director who was recently arrested after accusing Guillame Harushimana of killing three nuns last September. Police stood by and later asked the protesters to leave.

Dozens protested on ""Green Tuesday"" demanding the release of Bob Rugurika, a radio station director who was recently arrested for broadcasting alleged testimony regarding the September 2014 murder of three nuns.

Around 150 journalists and members of civil society demonstrated in support of jailed African Public Radio Director, Bob Rugurika. The protest was officially banned, but police did not intervene.
Supporters of the jailed African Public Radio director, Bob Rugurika, protested in front of the courthouse to ask for his release. The protest was technically banned, but police did not stop it.

Thousands of protesters welcomed the release on bail of African Public Radio director Bob Rugurika, who has been in jail since January for publishing an interview of a person suspected of murdering three nuns in 2014.
In the largest protest in recent years, thousands gathered to welcome the release on bail of the Africa Public Radio director Bob Rugurika and to demand change and increased democracy.

Commission Nationale de Terre et Autres Biens (CNTB) officials, accompanied by 11 police officers and an agent of the national intelligence service, were prevented from accessing the area of Buheka Hill after residents armed themselves with clubs and machetes and blocked the Buheka-Vugizo road with rocks and trees. The police beat a resident, while others threw rocks at the officers. At least one officer also fired shots into the crowd but no casualties were reported.

Thousands of Burundians took part in a ""government backed rally for peace"", where leaders spoke out against opposition, civil groups and the media. The rally follows a large demonstration last month following the release of a popular journalist and government critic from jail.

column17: A man was kidnapped by armed men who were allegedly Imbonerakure, taken to Rukoko and then ransomed.

Unknown gunmen attacked a military post in the Rukoko natural reserve, and they exchanged gunfire for about five minutes.

The armed men involved were allegedly Imbonerakure.

Some protesters threw stones in response, and more than 100 were arrested.
Arrests: Burundi has charged 65 protestors with rebellion after they were arrested during clashes with police while calling for the president not to seek re-election.

column8: Mutiny of Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: A group of soldiers ""mutinied"" and Major General Godefroid Niyombare publicly declared a coup d'etat, but President Nkurunziza claimed the government still had control and that loyalists within the military ""fought off rival soldiers"". After the coup declaration, police withdrew from the streets and protesters celebrated freely. A total of 12 mutineers were killed and 30 injured in the fighting over two days.

column8: Mutiny of Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: Rival factions within the security forces clashed around the state television and radio complex, fighting intense battles until the pro-coup troops were repulsed. A total of 12 mutineers were killed and 30 injured in the fighting over two days. Anti-coup forces repelled a major attack by rival troops, leaving at least three dead. Gunfire and clashes were reported throughout the city and smoke could be seen on Bujumburas skyline. A total of 12 mutineers were killed and 30 injured in the fighting over two days.

column8: Mutiny of Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: Police and/or military forces stormed the Bumerec Private Hospital looking for coup leaders, leading to a gunbattle with pro-coup soldiers inside which left at least one injured and perhaps one dead. The police withdrew but later attacked and searched the hospital, firing live ammunition, causing significant material damage, and taking three pro-coup soldiers captive.

column8: Mutiny of Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)

Police forces beat protesters who gather this morning. Then, despite several arrests, they tried to erect barricades

Outside of Bujumbura, hundreds of youth protested in the area surrounding the home of the vice president of the ruling party, Diomedes Ndabahinyuye. They blocked streets with tree trunks and stumps and later rioters set fire to his home. Eight houses burnt by rioters over the day, including police officer houses.
Demonstrations were reported in Mutakura and Nyakabiga.
Grenade was thrown, but didn't explode.

column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi

Denouncing at least 8 illegal arrests, a crowd occupied the street and erected barricades. Local source reports that the police searched the households of the chief leaders of the opposition parties in this county. No weapon was found, yet they still arrested 8 leaders and led them to the prison of Makamba. The police accused them of wanting to prepare protests against the third term.

Protesters rally in areas where Imbonerakure took previously-arrested demonstrators. During the protests in Mbizi, an individual was injured by a police bullet, and 3 people were arrested.
1 young man disappeared following protests; his body was found 2 days later

Members of the FNL were arrested after the murder of a member of the Imbonerakure. 5 more militants were arrested in addition to the 9 already arrested. A man was tortured and trasfered to the hospital, in addition to the 4 already hospitalized under police guard.

Students protest in front of the US embassy

Police tried to remove hundreds of students who were camping out in front of the US Embassy in Bujumbura since the start of protests and closure of universities in April. They chased many away, but 100 - 200 climbed the railing into the compound to seek refuge; they left the Embassy later that night.

2 died and 6 were wounded in a grenade attack at a bar. The perpetrators remain unidentified.
One person has been beaten by unidentified armed men. Local source reports the person was injured with a machete.

Unidentified attackers threw grenades at a civilians home the day after 2 were killed by a grenade attack in the same province. No injuries were reported. Local source says the home stormed belongs to a member of FNL.
Local source says unidentified armed men wearing military clothes attacked the house of a civilian who was wounded. The police had to intervene, firing at the criminals.
Six unidentified armed men stormed a village, while wearing military clothes.
Following the arrest of a MSD member, barricades are erected/
Grenade thrown on a truck delivering an oil station. At least, two wounded
Tensions in Musaga, where neither cars nor bus are allowed to come through the neighbourhood. People want the release of a young man arrested yesterday.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man was beaten up by Imbonerakure. He went to the municipal authorities and police to complain.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Following the murder of a member of Imbonerakure, there is a hunt for the alleged-responsible members of the Alliance ""Espoir de Burundais"" of Rwasa. 4 people were recovered, 8 people were arrested, and 3 teachers were embedded by the prosecutor
6 armed men, wearing military dress, stormed a house, and shot at his owner, who got wounded. Police intervene, several gunshots.
6 armed men, wearing military dress, stormed a house, and shot at his owner, who got wounded. Police intervene, several gunshots.
A police officer killed a politician, member of MSD.
A man was killed around 10PM by unidentified armed men.
Defusal: Grenade was found, unexploded. Police intervene to neutralize it.
Grenades thrown, but did not explode
Security measures: Police raid peoples home suspected to be members of FNL party
A man was beaten up by the police, thentreated at Makamba hospital.
Alleged police offices killed two.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Refugees, returning back to Burundi are rob and assaulted by Imbonerakure in Cibitoke, Burundi
Barricades erected, gunshots heard
A grenade explodes, wounding a police officer seriously and another civilian
Grenade explosions and automatic gunfire were heard in the Mutakura and Kanyosha neighbourhoods of Bujumbura. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified armed men open fire on a cash escort, killing one alongside a street seller and one police officer.

column8: Mutiny of Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: Soldiers clashed with mutineer military forces loyal to Gen Godefroy Niyombare; it is unclear who attacked first. Final reports indicate that at least 12 were killed, four injured, and one captured in total.
On 9 July 2015, grenade explosions and automatic gunfire were heard between unidentified armed groups in the Mutakura and Kanyosha neighbourhoods of Bujumbura. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
Two police officers were killed in a grenade attack in the Mukaza area of Bujumbura.

column8: Mutiny of Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: Soldiers clashed with mutineer military forces loyal to Gen Godefroy Niyombare; it is unclear who attacked first. Final reports indicate that at least 12 were killed, four injured, and one captured in total.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Clashes between Imbonerakure and the Coalition of Hope Burundians for political divergence.
Security measures: Police conduct an unauthorized search at a Rwasa supporters party. No weapons found.
One person killed after a night of violence in Bujumbura

At least one civilian was killed by police in overnight clashes in contested areas of Bujumbura. Police responded with live ammunition after a series of 10 grenade blasts targeted police positions in the three Bujumbura communes of Ntahangwa, Mukaza, and Muha.

At least one civilian was killed by police in overnight clashes in contested areas of Bujumbura. Police responded with live ammunition after a series of 10 grenade blasts targeted police positions in the three Bujumbura communes of Ntahangwa, Mukaza, and Muha.

At least one civilian was killed by police in overnight clashes in contested areas of Bujumbura. Police responded with live ammunition after a series of 10 grenade blasts targeted police positions in the three Bujumbura communes of Ntahangwa, Mukaza, and Muha.
On Nyamabere hill, unidentified armed men attack two houses, killing one, wounding another, and stealing 13.000Fbi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: Imbonerakure attacked and beat up members of FRODEBU and CECI; they also stolen their mobile phones.

column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service; CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Those fleeing Burundi through Kirundo were beaten and stripped of the ID documents and belongings, and are detained in secret prisons. This is carried out on order of a mission from the governor to police, SNR agens, and Imbonerakure.
Youths erected barricades to block streets following the arrests of 2 people by the police.
Polices beat customers in a bar.
The Muzinda military camp commander was wounded by an unidentified armed group on Rugazi-Muzinda road.
Non-violent activity: Gunshots heard

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Member of FNL was assaulted by three Imbonerakure.

column8: Mutiny of Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: The Burundian army claims it has killed 31 fighters and captured 170 others in clashes that occurred in Kabarore on Jul.10 (coded previously) and Bukinanyana on July.11. 1 civilian was also killed in Bukinanyana and another injured. 6 soldiers were injured. Exiled General Leonard Ngendakumana claimed the attacks.
Police position was attacked by armed group. One assaulter was killed.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 07 November. SNR agents forcibly disappeared a civilian from Ngozi province.
An FNL member was attacked by over a dozen unidentified people. He escaped and could recognise 2 people among the aggressors.
2 people abducted by an armed group on 5th avenue in Gihanga. They were directed to Rukoko forest.
Gunshots over Nyabitare hill. 1 person among the offenders died.
A policeman was shot dead and a soldier was wounded during an attack by an unknown armed group.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: Two young member of the MSD found killed this morning in Mutakura
Arrests: At least 60 members of Amizero yAbarundi, a group headed by Agathon Rwasa, were arrested across Muyinga province.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: 2 people were killed during the night by unidentified assailants, although some sources believe they were ""agents of documentation and police"". Their bodies were found tied up in a stream the next morning.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: Arrests: A leader of FRODEBU was arrested by an SNR agent in Kavogeno neighborhood. They accused him of recruiting youths to join the rebellion.
A young man was found dead in Marangara after local residents heard someone begging for their life during the night and then a grenade exploding.
Gitara police chief hit a man with his walking stick.
Security measures: Police conduct search into a hotel and private houses, in Sanzu. No weapons found.
Detonation: Explosions and gunshots heard in Nyakabiga and Jabe. One person, trying to throw a grenade, killed himself in Nyakabiga.
Non-violent activity: Explosion and gunshots heard in Nyakabiga and Jabe
Post office was attacked. Several explosion and gunshots were heard
On 13 July 2015, an unidentified armed group abducted a teacher in Muhuta commune (Rumonge).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure and opposition members clashed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: Gunshots heard; alleged Imbonerakure.
Non-violent activity: Gunshots heard. Local source says no victims, and perpetrators still unknown.

Clashes erupted in Cibitoke province around Kiruhura and Kato (lat/longs not available) after an unidentified armed group attacked a military post on the edge of the Kibira forest. At least 8 attackers were killed while 1 soldier was wounded.
Security measures: The police searched the house of a member of CNDD-FDD. No weapons found.
8 unidentified gunmen were ambushed and killed by soldiers as they came out of the Kibira forest. A soldier was also wounded in the fighting.

2 demonstrators opposed to President Nkurunziza were wounded by police gunfire as they protested near a campaign rally by the CNDD-FDD in an area with many opponents of the current president. As tensions between the groups rose, police opened fire on the opposition demonstrators.
Security measures: The police searched some houses in Ndago hill.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 people were beaten by a group of Imbonerakure as well as 5 police officers (including Head of local Police) for allegedly detaining weapons. One escaped, but the other, seriously injured, passed away the following day at the hospital.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Clashes occurred between SNR agents and the inhabitants of Buheka hill. The agents were in place to arrest an activist of Coalition of Hope Burundians (Amizero yAbarundi), but his neighbors came to prevent it.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A trader was beaten up by Imbonerakure. They forced the traders of bars and shops to close around 20.30.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Clashes between Imbonerakure and the opposition party.
Clashes between Coalition of Hope Burundians (Amizero yAbarundi) and Alliance Copa for political quarrel.
A house, belonging to a member of Coalition of Hope Burundais (Amizero yAbarundi), was set on fire. Perpetrators are unknown.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Security measures: imbonerakure searched houses, one of which belongs to a member of Coalition of Hope Burundais (Amizero yAbarundi).
Following the disarmament of a police officer by youth, police forces were deployed around Bwiza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A group of suspected Imbonerakure stormed the house of an Rwasa FNL acctivist who was having a drink with another supporter. Gunfire and grenade blasts were heard, resulting in one killed and another who died of his injuries.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 members of the Amizero were beaten by 6 Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 people harassed and beaten up by Imbonerakure while they were fleeing the country. Imbonerakure checks the borders.
Motorcyclist attacked and stabbed by armed people. He is now hospitalised.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A member of Imbonerakure injured by unknown armed people. He is now hospitalised.
Jabe street were barricaded early this morning.
In Kibago, grenade was thrown and two small bridges were destroyed, in order to prevent citizens from participating in the presidential election.
Several grenades thrown. No casualties
Attempt to erect barricades, but Police forces prevent it.
Over the night, attacks made on the commune. One youth was wounded with a stray bullet, sparking subsequent protest.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: The vice president of the MSD in Gitega was found dead after gunfire was heard in the night between 4th and 5th Avenue in Nyakabiga III.
Youth in Nyakabiga protested, burned tires and blocked streets after the vice president of the MSD in Gitega was found dead in their neighbourhood. Police were present.
Grenade thrown; no casualties reported.
2 people injured during the launch of a grenade.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The population of the area protested after a member of Coalition of Hope Burundais (Amizero yAbarundi) was arrested by Imbonerakure, until the victim was released.
Barricades erected, people gather to denounce third bid. Gunshots and explosions have been heard too.
A grenade went off near the city centre of Bujumbura. No casualties were reported but a car was damaged.
Barricades erected, people gather to denounce third bid. Gunshots and explosions have been heard too.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: One killed, alleged MSD member.
Barricades erected, people gather to denounce third bid. Gunshots and explosions have been heard too.
A police officer was killed in overnight violence and demonstrations during which gunfire and explosions were heard.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure argued violently at a poll station. The police officer who tried to stop the clash was seriously injured by one of the Imbonerakure.
Arrests: In Gisuru and Kinyinya cities, 55 people arrested for being suspected rebels. They had weapons.
Arrests: In Gisuru and Kinyinya cities, 55 people arrested for being suspected rebels. They had weapons.
A Rwasa FNL member was killed when he was shot and had a grenade thrown at him as he left his home for a meeting.
Movement of forces: The African Union has begun the deployment of military observers and human rights monitors in Burundi as vote counting in the presidential election began.
Police officers tried to arrest one person, clashes erupted with local people to prevent the arrest.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 4 people were injured, including 3 children, when a grenade was thrown at the house of a local head of the ruling party.
FNL member killed

Relatives and neighbours of an FNL member who was killed carried his body in a procession to the cemetery. Police attempted to prevent the ""human tide"" in their procession but were unable to stop them.
Grenade thrown in front of the house of Bwizas mayor. At least 4 wounded, including one young boy.
FNL member killed
1 killed and another kidnapped by military dressed men.
Clashes between the Burundian army (who caught a suspected insurgent and seized 26 rifles and 68 military uniforms) and a rebel groups near Nyanza-Lac. Gunshots heard.

6 youths connected to the FNL were evicted from a house in Kamango in Ruyaga area and then arrested due to allegedly possessing weapons and being ""part of a rebellion"". Some of them were allegedly beaten.
Grenade thrown, one killed and several other people wounded.
Sit-in against a candidate for the hill.
In Kinyinya, 49 people accused of belonging to a rebel group are being held in critical condition in prison since Monday. 2 of them, aged under 18, were released in the evening yesterday.
A militant of FNL abducted and taken to an unknown destination.
Clashes between the regular military forces and an armed group. The man kidnapped on July 26 was able to escape.
Grenade blast killed one policeman in Bujumbura. Another policeman injured. Gunshots were heard right after the explosion.

Security measures: in Nyanza-Lac, a former fighter of CNDD is searched by police. He is suspected of being responsible for a grenade attack on the eve of parliamentary and municipal elections and for being part of an armed group who destabilized the country.
29 July. Police forcibly disappeared a civilian in Gitega province.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Member of Independents coalition (Amizero yAbarundi) was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure, then by Police officers. When he tried to denounce the events, he was jailed.
One killed in Musaga

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Gunmen in military uniforms kill 2 members of CNDD-FDD in their homes in Ruvyagira, 25km southwest of Bujumbura.
A young man was kidnapped by an armed group, dressed in military uniforms. They also robbed a store.
Grenade thrown in a house wounded two persons.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Local head of CNDD-FDD was threatened by unidentified men that killed his dog.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A member of the Imbonerakure was killed in the Musaga neighborhood of Bujumbura.
Grenade was thrown at police officers. One of them was wounded.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure chased (using clubs) anyone in a bar who was not a CNDD-FDD member.
Following the killing of a police officer, police forces begin searching houses, assaulting civilians.
A man killed a police officer in Ngagara.
Journalist Esdras Ndikumana was arrested at the scene of the assassination of a top general in Bujumbura and was badly beaten by government security agents.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Former Intelligence Chief Adolphe Nshimirimana and his driver were killed when their car was hit by rockets and gunfire by unidentified men in military uniform in the Kamenge neighborhood of Bujumbura. 7 arrests were made relation to the attack and several others are sought by authorities. The vehicle used in the attack came from a Bujumbura military camp.
Grenade killed 1 person, and injured seriously another. 8 people were later arrested and jailed in Mpanda.

column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: Stones launched by unidentified people at the house belonging to a representative of FRODEBU
Investigating on the murder of Nshimirimana, a journalist of RFI was jailed and beaten for two hours by Police Forces.
Three police officers killed and several others injured. A lot of gunshots are heard throughout the city, without knowing who shot.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 1 man was beaten by 2 Imbonerakure, following the death of Nshimirimana.
One person was killed, and his wife seriously wounded by a grenade attack in Mpanda. 8 persons were arrested.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 2 August 2015, a local ruling party (CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure) official was assassinated by an unidentified armed group in the Kanyosha district of Bujumbura.
Vehicles were burned by unknown groups in the Musaga and Cibitoke neighbourhoods of Bujumbura.
Vehicles were burned by unknown groups in the Musaga and Cibitoke neighbourhoods of Bujumbura.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A member of CNDD-FDD was killed this morning.
A soldier was injured by gunfire while in pursuit of unidentified gunmen in vehicles in Bujumbura.
Pierre-Claver Mponimpa, leader of the Burundian civil society, was seriously injured by unknown man.
A youth was beaten by the chief of Kirambi hill, accusing him for trying to kill him. He is hospitalised.
An armed group attacked a maid and beat up a family in their home, robbing them of 2 cows and household items.
One man found dead in Cibitoke. Impossible to identify him, locals are not even sure he was killed in Cibitoke.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 4 August 2015, a man, accused of robbery, died from injuries caused after being beaten by Mabanda inhabitants armed with machetes. The man was identified as being a member of Imbonerakure.
Arrests: 55 youths, alleged to be rebels, were arrested while possessing weapons in Gisuru and Kinyinya. It includes the local MSD leader.
Arrests: 55 youths, alleged to be rebels, were arrested while possessing weapons in Gisuru and Kinyinya.
Two local representatives were injured after a grenade attack

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Looting: Imbonerakure and a local civil servant looted the house of an opponent whose disagreed publicly against the president.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man who returned from Rwanda was beaten by Imbonerakure and robbed of 10,000BIF.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Property destruction: Imbonerakure and a councilor of Kibonde Hill destroyed the house of an opponent whose son had expressed defamation against the president.
Defusal: After being warned by the population, the police found at least 30 Kalashnikovs in a field.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Local president of the CNDD-FDD, Come Harerimana, was killed when unidentified attackers threw a brick at his motorcycle while he was driving.
One soldier was killed. He protected an officer, who was targeted during this attack by unidentified men
One man was severely beaten by Police officers, after having an argument with a pharmacist.

Two civilians were killed by police in the Cibitoke neighborhood of Bujumbura on either the 5th or 6th of August in what appeared to be a targeted killing using either live ammunition or grenades. The victims may have been DRC refugees.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Arrests: 27 students were arrested by the SNR agents, alleged to be rebels. 25 were released after investigation.

column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: Arrests: Leaders of FRODEBU were arrested
Two bodies were found by passers-by in the Buterere neighbourhood of Bujumbura, an opposition hotbed. Both bodies were bound by ropes and bore signs of torture.

column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Arrests: A former militant of the FNL party was arrested, alleged to be part of a rebel group, and taken to SNR office.
One soldier was injured when 2 grenades exploded in Musaga.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man was beaten by Imbonerakure in Ntega.
Property destruction: One government vehicle was burnt in Nyakabiga.
An armed group attacked a military patrol in Gihanga. Gunshots were heard; no casualties were reported; assaulters withdrew into the forest.
One man was wounded in his house. He used to travel back to Rwanda to visit his family, which was not accepted by local civil servants.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Two young students were beaten up and arrested by Imbonerakure, accused of distributing weapons and selling their goats to send money to their families in Rwanda. They are now in police prison.
Two grenades were launched in confrontations between police and unidentified assailants overnight in the Cibitoke neighbourhood of Bujumbura.
Gunfire, detonations, and confrontations between police and ""insurgents"" were reported for two hours in the Bujumbura neighbourhood of Nyakabiga, where at least one grenade was launched.
Several grenades exploded in Bujumburas Kwijabe neighbourhood.
One member of the Coalition of Independent (opposition) was attacked yesterday. He was wounded in the head.
Non-violent activity: Several Explosions and gunshots heard in Cibitoke

Gunfire, detonations, and confrontations between police and ""insurgents"" were reported overnight in the Bujumbura neighborhood of Jabe, where 4 grenades were launched and 2 police were injured. The following day, police conducted home searches throughout Jabe.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man was tortured by Imbonerakure and taken to the police station, accused of rejoicing at the death of Nshimirimana.
Non-violent activity: Several Explosions and gunshots heard in Ngagara

Security measures: Since the beginning of the week, police conducted home raids in the Jabe, Musaga, and Mutakura neighbourhoods of Bujumbura where they discovered two guns, one grenade, and other military effects.

Security measures: Since the beginning of the week, police conducted home raids in the Jabe, Musaga, and Mutakura neighbourhoods of Bujumbura where they discovered two guns, one grenade, and other military effects.
One man was killed overnight. Local source says that he was likely strangled.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure wounds man with a machete a man

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Member of Imbonerakure slightly wounded during an argument with his other fellows about their favorite candidates.

column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: Unknown people throw stones at the roof of FRODEBU representatives house.

An employee of the University of Burundi was arrested by armed policemen at a restaurant in central Bujumbura. His decomposing body was found days later, with fingers missing and a bullet wound to the head.
During a home search, police found a weapons cache and the local population responded by lynching the two perpetrators. Police tried unsuccessfully to stop the mob by firing in the air.

Security measures: Since the beginning of the week, police conducted home raids in the Jabe, Musaga, and Mutakura neighborhoods of Bujumbura where they discovered two guns, one grenade, and other military effects.
Grenades were heard followed by gunfire in the Bwiza, Nyakabiga, and Cibitoke neighbourhoods of Bujumbura.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A man and his wife were killed by gunfire or a grenade in the Kamenge area while returning home from a bar. The man was known to be a member of the ruling party, though he may have expressed opposition to a third term by President Nkurunziza.
Grenades were heard followed by gunfire in the Bwiza, Nyakabiga, and Cibitoke neighborhoods of Bujumbura.
Grenades were heard followed by gunfire in the Bwiza, Nyakabiga, and Cibitoke neighbourhoods of Bujumbura.
Grenades thrown on a vehicle, injuring two. One passed away later at the hospital.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy

One grenade exploded in Jabe, followed by gunshots.

Grenades thrown on the car of a Police Colonel (who was going back home), two injured.
4 people were kidnapped by armed men in Gihanga.
The body of a man found near Sanzu river.

While going back home, ex-General Staff Jean Bikomagu was killed by two man on a motorcycle. His daughter was also injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Clashes between Imbonerakure and civilians during electoral campaign. Imbonerakure didn't want the campaign to be lead by a non-Imbonerakure member.

Retired head of Burundis former primarily Tutsi army, Col. Jean Bikomagu, was killed when unidentified assailants opened fire on his car outside of his home in Kinindo. His daughter was also seriously injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The households of Two FNL militants attacked by 20 Imbonerakure. They were beaten, robbed and taken to the police station.
Two grenades were thrown at a car in the Jabe neighborhood of Bujumbura. The driver and his children were able to escape as the car burned completely.

column8: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: SNR police forces tried to arrest one man who allegedly recruited youth for the rebellion. Civilians protested against this arrest and clashes with police forces ensued. Nobody was arrested.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Local head of Imbonerakure in Mayuyu was attacked with a grenade. He escaped and was not wounded.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Four people were killed in a bar in the Musaga neighbourhood as an apparent revenge killing. The victims were accused of supporting the ruling party and being police informers.
A grenade exploded and wounded 3 police officers and 5 civilians (including one old man and a young girl). Police forces allegedly targeted.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: One person abducted by Imbonerakure.
2 persons were wounded in a grenade attack.

A grenade was thrown at a bar targeting the husband of Senator Spes-Njebarikanuye Caritas, the first Vice President of the Senate. Two shopkeepers were seriously injured.
A military position was attacked, leaving one dead and several wounded.
One man was found dead in the early morning, alleged to have been killed overnight for his involvement in the anti-3rd Bid protests.
Army officer Philbert Niyonjuru was found dead - apparently bound and executed and wearing civilian clothes. Another dead body was also found in the Musaga neighbourhood.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The administrator of the Isale commune, who is a member of the FNL party, was killed when gunmen from the Imbonerakure opened fire on a bar. Several others were injured.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An alleged Imbonerakure beaten to death by unknown people.
Man stabbed by unknown person.
Police reportedly shot and killed a fisherman in Kibenga.
Shots were fired between unidentified individuals and the police in the Cibitoke neighbourhood of Bujumbura as authorities searched homes and found weapons and military equipment.
Young supporters of candidates clashed on Monday morning while spreading propaganda near polling places. Police had to intervene to separate them away from polling places.
A retailer was beaten by armed group; the aggressors went then to Rukambasi forest.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: CNDD-FDD member was murdered near his house.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: One person abducted by Imbonerakure.
Unidentified gunmen attacked the home of protest organizer Richard Muyuku, killing him and injuring his wife and mother.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: Arrests: A former CNDD-FDD, now MSD, arrested while he was fleeing in Rwanda.
Following the arrest of a local politician, supporters gathered to ask for his release. Local source says he is in charge of fraud.
Non-violent activity: Gunshots were heard in the Mukike commune as police conducted home searches.
Unidentified men abducted a protest organizer and took him to an unknown location.
Unknown people launched stones at an electoral observants house.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 4 Imbonerakure were attacked by other members of Imbonerakure due to an argument following local elections, local source says. The attackers supported an opponent who lost at the polls. 5 arrests occurred.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Following the election of Mukamba local head, Imbonerakure protest to denounce this election and ask for a new poll.
Over the night, in Cibitoke, people gather and protest, singing, denouncing illegalilty of Nkurunziza s third mandate.
A policeman beat a man in a bar. This incident comes in the wake of numerous intimidations and similar incidents.
Security measures: The police conducted a search in a new elector leaders house. No weapons found. MSD reported increased intimidation by the police.
Movement of forces: Police and Military forces deployed on the streets after residents reported the crossing of an armed group yesterday.
Jimmy Elvis Vyizigiro, a journalist working for France 24, was attacked in his home by masked intruders who beat him as they searched for documents he collected regarding flaws in recent elections.
One police officer was killed by unidentified armed men. His weapon was stolen too.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man wounded by Imbonerakure armed with machete.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man was wounded by an Imbonerakure.
Former military officer was found dead in Nyabunyegeri. A few days before, he was arrested by Police forces and jailed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Several Imbonerakure attacked a household where Amizero relatives live.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: Men in military uniform fired on a home in Musaga, killing two and injuring three. The victims may have been opposition activists.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A Rwandan coming back from his country was severely beaten by the local head of the Imbonerakure. He was accused of having supported rebels. The border post was closed for 5 hours following the incident.
One person died and several were injured when an army patrol team opened fire ""for no apparent reason"" on protesters in the Musaga neighborhood of Bujumbura.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: Abel Nzambimana of the MSD party was killed and his wife was injured by gunfire and grenades targeting their home.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: An ""influential member"" of the CNDD-FDD was found dead in Ruyaga.
A truck was attacked by unidentified men dressed in military clothes. One military officer was wounded. Attackers robbed everything.
Grenade wounds two people
Protesters threw stones at police who responded with gunfire and explosions. One person was killed in overnight clashes.
Police and protesters clashed through the night.
One man - a police officer - was found dead.
One person was killed in overnight clashes with police.
Clashes in Nyakabiga between unidentified armed men and the police forces end up with one person killed by the police forces, 1 wounded.
Two ""insurgents"" were killed in clashes with police.
Mid-day clashes took place between protesters and police who circled the Musaga neighbourhood to conduct searches.
Police officers fired on a youth.
One civilian killed and a police officer wounded during a grenade attack.
Man beaten into a coma by unknown attacker.
Body found in a river in Cibitoke. Impossible to identify him.

Protests broke out overnight from the 2nd to 3rd and explosions and gunfire were heard between rioters and police in Cibitoke, Musaga, Mutakura, and Ngarara in Bujumbura. Dozens were injured on both sides and dozens were arrested.
Mid-day clashes took place between protesters and police who circled the Musaga neighborhood to conduct searches.

Protests broke out overnight from the 2nd to 3rd and explosions and gunfire were heard between rioters and police in Cibitoke, Musaga, Mutakura, and Ngarara in Bujumbura. Dozens were injured on both sides and dozens were arrested.

column6: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A MSD beat an Imbonerakure and burnt his motorbike.
Grenade thrown killed one police officer near a bar.

Following the death of a police officer in Musaga, police forces enter a bar from where the grenade was alleged to have been thrown, opening fire and wounding two youth. Police officers arrest at least 30 persons in a bar, beat them, following the death of a police officer a few hours before.
Arrests: 70 arrested as suspected rebels in Kinyinya.

Protests broke out overnight from the 2nd to 3rd and explosions and gunfire were heard between rioters and police in Cibitoke, Musaga, Mutakura, and Ngarara in Bujumbura. Dozens were injured on both sides and dozens were arrested.

Jean-Claude Ciza, a journalist who previously worked for a state broadcaster and now works with Radio France Internationale, was beaten with a steel bar by a police officer while covering events in the Musaga neighborhood of Bujumbura.
Man killed in Gikwiye by armed attackers.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Man beaten by Imbonerakure on orders of new chief of Rugarama.

column16: Undisclosed Source; Radio Television Nationale du Burundi
column17: Armed men in military clothing ambushed the public prosecutor hear his home in Ruyigi. Grenades and gunfire were heard; the prosecutor escaped unharmed, while his police body guard was injured.
In clashes between gunmen and soldiers, one assailant was killed.
While attacking a relay mast, armed men wound two security guard.

column9: UPD-Z: Union for Peace and Development (Zigamibanga Faction)
column17: Patrice Gahungu, spokesman for the UPD-Zigamibanga party, was shot dead near his home. The victim had very recently won in a complaint to the UN Committee Against Torture, claiming he had been tortured by the state in 2010 and deserved compensation.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: CNDD-FDD assault motorcyclists. Police intervened.
Rioters threw stones and burned a home in Mbizi.
Gunmen wearing military uniforms attacked a military camp in Kiyenzi. Two assailants were killed and three soldiers injured.
A total of four people were killed overnight in the Cibitoke and Kamenge neighborhoods in Bujumbura.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Ruling party member attempted to drown a Hope Coalition member, wounding him in the head.
4 injured in grenade attacks in market in Murama.
Body seen floating in Ruvubu River in Ruyange.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A total of four people were killed overnight in the Cibitoke and Kamenge neighborhoods in Bujumbura. This included a driver for the CNDD-FDD in Cibitoke.
On 8 September 2015, at least four people were seriously injured in a grenade explosion that targeted a household in the Kanyosha neighbourhood in Bujumbura.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: Imbonerakure beat a man because of his FRODEBU affiliation.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Hope Coalition activists torched the house of an Imbonerakure. No casualties.
1 person killed, another injured when gunmen attacked a house in Gishingwe.
After capturing 7 armed men in Kirari in Kivyuka, military reportedly execute them.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a man for failing to participate in night patrols.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure beat up and injured his Pro-FNL Rwasa father for supporting opposition in local elections.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a pregnant woman.
Non-violent activity: Gunshots and Explosions were heard in Gasanda. No casualties.
Grenade attack on bar in Bwiza, targeting UPRONA member. No casualties reported.
Non-violent activity: Gunfire in Mutakura.
One soldier was wounded on the road to the airport. Unknown armed men also stole his weapon.

column6: Mutiny of Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: Two assailants, three soldiers, and one civilian were killed in an ambush that targeted the convoy of Burundian Army Chief of Staff Major General Prime Niyongabo. Niyongabo escaped unharmed. The attackers are reportedly current soldiers in the Burundian army.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: One CNDD-FDD supporter was killed by unknown armed man.
Man killed in Jabe because he was suspected of being an informant for SNR.
One person killed another injured in attack by unknown gunmen.
One man killed on the road from Cibitoke to Kinama.
Non-violent activity: Explosions and gunshots in Cibitoke area.
Police forces burnt a shop, claiming that the owner has given food to opposition members.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Imbonerakure and CNDD-FDD leader arrested three youth, tortured and bound them.
Arrests: 40 youths arrests, suspected over joining rebelliion.
Body found in Rohero. Unclear circumstances of his death.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: A dead body of a MSD youth leader found in Buterere. He was likely strangled. This was the fourth murdered body found in the area in the last month.
Shots and screams were heard overnight, and in the morning an unidentified body was found ""assassinated"" in the Cibitoke area. 2 other bodies found in bags.
Arrests: 50 persons arrested in Gitega.
Man shot in arm by unknown gunmen in Rubira, Musenyi.
Security measures: Searches in Mutakura.
Pro-UPRONA advisor in Ruhehe shot dead.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure lay an ambush for a motorcyclist who helped people travel to Tanzania. Motorcyclist injured.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Local head, affiliated to CNDD-FDD, was shot down by unknown armed men.
Man who was arrested in possession of a grenade was then found dead the following morning in Buterere.
A dead body wrapped in a bag was found in Nyabagere River in Mutakura.
Security measures: Police raids of MSD presidents home in Budaketwa, Gitara.
Security measures: Searches in Kigwati, Mabanda
Security measures: Searches of an INAMA citizen reporters house in Mabanda in September, accused of inciting people to revolt.

Arrests: More than 100 men in the central province were arrested over two days by security forces claiming to prevent their recruitment into rebel forces. The men were said to be moving in large numbers towards the south.
Grenade launched into a bar in Kamenge, no casualties.

Following the attack on 11/09/2015 in Ruyigi (Gasanga), police forces engaged in house searching including the Maison Shalom NGO. Its driver was mistreated and seems to have sheltered in Rwanda. Two employees of the same NGO were also arrested.
Arrests: 37 arrested, including 2 Rwandans.
Security measures: Police search Mbizi, seize rifles.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure was beaten by a bus driver. He wanted to check all the passengers, but the driver refused.
4 bodies were found in freshly dug graves. They were tied up and difficult to identify.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a money changer in Bishiha, Busoni.
Security measures: Police searches in Nyakabiga.
Security measures: Police search home suspected of possessing weapons, no weapons found.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Clash between Imbonerakure and armed man. Armed man stabbed to death. Imbonerakure fled with a wound.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Clash between Imbonerakure and FNL militant in Magarama.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: Arrests: More than 30 MSD members in Mivo, Kayogoro arrested by security forces claiming to prevent their recruitment into rebel forces.
Gunshots and explosions targeted two police stations in Mutakura and police had the area completely blocked off by the following morning.
Police on patrol in Buterere were attacked by a grenade but escaped unharmed.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Rapid Mobile Intervention Group
column17: GMIR search and beat civilians in Jimbi.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Rapid Mobile Intervention Group
column17: GMIR search and beat civilians in Kibago.
Non-violent activity: Heavy gunfire heard in Mayuyu.
Non-violent activity: Gunfire and grenade heard in Mutakura.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Rapid Mobile Intervention Group
column17: GMIR seriously beat a student in Rubimba. In critical condition.
One person was injured in a grenade attack in Kinyankonge.
A grenade was launched near the northern bus station in Kamenge but did not cause injuries. Three suspects were arrested.
US embassy in Burundi employee killed in Cibitoke.
Unknown group kill a man suspected of working with police and security agents to identify rebel youths. During the attack, two others injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat the prosecutor of Rutana in Gatabo.

Body found in Buterere, killed by gunfire.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Security measures: Searches in MSD and FNL homes in Mabanda, suspected of harboring insurgents. No weapons found.
Rioters burn house of suspected witch.

15 bodies were found in various neighborhoods of Bujumbura during the week of Sept 23rd. Assassinated bodies are found almost daily in the city, many of them opposition members and activists. The perpetrators are unknown, though many residents point to state forces and Imbonerakure.

column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: FRODEBU member beaten in Bihembe.
Men in civilian clothes arrest and beat a man in Musaga, for participating in anti-third term protests.
Gunshots and explosions between police and armed group in Mutakura. Police then fired shots into a home believed to be housing the attackers. 1 person killed.
Police beat people in a bar.
Gunshots and explosions between police and armed group in Cibitoke. 2 policemen killed, 2 youths arrested.
Police vehicle in Musaga attacked with a grenade. No casualties reported.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Security measures: Searches in Cibitoke.
Amizero member shot dead in Munyinya.

column17: CNDD-FDD activist injured by a UPRONA militant during an argument.
Man killed in Rubira, Musenyi. 3 arrested.
Security measures: Searches in Ngagara.
Arrests: 100 suspected rebels arrested in Kinyinya.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Security measures: Searches in Mutakura.
Police beat a woman who complained about shops closing for the visit of the head of Gitega province.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Rapid Mobile Intervention Group
column17: GMIR rape a girl in Mbizi.
A grenade was launched and gunfire shot at the house of the former chief of police William Nabindika. No injuries reported.
Man stopped on his motorcycle and executed at close range in Muyira.

A pyrotechnic mortar bomb launched by an unidentified group associated with other bombings was luanched in Kiriri, damaging the fence of a house belonging to Jesuit priests. Two other bombs landed in Kiriri without causing any damage.
A pyrotechnic mortar bomb launched by an unidentified group associated with other bombings was thrown in Kavumu, damaging one home.
One man killed in Bubanza by unknown group. Police arrested three of the mans sons.
Two bodies found on road to the airport.
Unknown group attacks Muvumu Nyabitare area of Gisuru. 2 police and 2 civilians injured. 1 civilian killed.

Rioters break into the office of the chief of Rugazi and destroy property and documents.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: MSD activist killed in Cibitoke.

9 were injured in a grenade attack on a bar. 5 were later arrested for suspected involvement.

column17: The president of the MSD in Muramvya commune, Jean Baptiste Nsengiyumva, was assassinated in front of his house on Mubira hill by unidentified men using guns and grenades.
Unknown group with machetes attacked a home in Gatare hill, Musigati, abducting one person.
Unknown group with machetes injure an elementary school teacher in Mugerero.
Policeman Jean-Claude Kazungu shot and killed in Ngarara.
Head of Burundi Information Documentation shot and killed.

column17: Security measures: GMIR search Jimbi.

Vigilante militia stone to death a suspected rapist.

Security measures: Police searches in Sanzu.
Defusal: Grenade found and recovered by police in Manga.

Military attack civilians in Bujumbura, killing 2.
Grenades launched at the home of the area chief of Rugazi. No injuries reported.
Protests in Kiyonza after soldiers arrested a man.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat up a man in Butare hills in Kayogoro.
Violence between armed groups and the police in the Mutakura neighborhood of Bujumbura spilled over into Kamenge, and Ngagara, where gunfire and grenades could be heard throughout the day.
Violence between armed groups and the police in the Mutakura neighborhood of Bujumbura spilled over into Kamenge, and Ngagara, where gunfire and grenades could be heard throughout the day.
Police beat civilians in their home and fire in the air in Mutakura.
3 killed in Kibira forest.
Violence between armed groups and the police left at least 9 dead, including civilians, in the Mutakura area.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column16: HRW; AFP; Xinhua; RFI; Undisclosed Source
column17: Police with the aid of Imbonerakure attacked ""insurgents"" in the north of Bujumbura. Two police were injured, and two houses were burned in grenade attacks. The following morning, at least 7 bodies in civilian attire were seen being loaded into a police truck.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Security measures: Police and Imbonerakure search homes in Jimbi, no weapons found.
Three youths were killed by police officers in the Mutakura neighborhood of Bujumbura. They were reportedly told to lie on the ground before being executed. Police closed off roads in the area.
Group on motorcycles throw grenades at policemen in Bwiza. No injuries.
Group on motorcycles throw grenades at policemen in Kigobe, a few minutes after grenades were thrown at policemen nearby in Bwiza. No injuries.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure injure civilians in Mpanda.
A body found near Musaga football field in Kinanira area known as Socarti.
Grenades thrown at a minibus. 2 injured.
2 shepherds kidnapped in Buringa, later released along Rusizi river.
Security measures: Police search homes in Bikanka, no weapons found.
Grenades thrown at home of neighbourhood leader of FNL in Nyabagere Gihosha. Civilians injured.
Armed group on motorcycles threw a grenade at policemen. 5 injured, including 3 civilians and 2 policemen.
Child injured by stray bullets in Mutakura.
Continued protests at Gitega Prison. Police entered prison with machine guns, rocket launchers and tear gas, and allegedly beat alleged coup plotters that were protesting.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Rapid Mobile Intervention Group
column17: GMIR Police arrested and beat civilians in Kibago.
Man beaten with clubs by a former soldier (coded as Unidentified Armed Group because no longer a military soldier).

column17: Coup leader General Cyrille Ndayirukiye was severely beaten, shot in the head, and restrained by armed police in the Gitega prison, while prisoners were protesting for new construction of isolation cells.
Man abducted in Kamenge, body found the next day in Nyabagere river in Ntahangwa.
Police kill 3 youths in Mutakura; residents said civilians were asked to lie face down and then they were run over.
A dead body with the arms tied was found in Mutimbizi, and a second body was found nearby with bullet wounds. Potentially connected to recent killings in Bujumbura.
Grenades thrown at Gitega commune ministers home. No casualties.

Body found in Mutimbuzi river.

Unidentified men detonated grenades and opened fire inside a compound hosting a bar and a car transport agency, injuring one and destroying the property. The owner of the car agency is said to be Rwandan, which may be the motivation behind the attack.
A corpse potentially related to recent clashes was found in Ngagara in Bujumbura.
Security measures: Searches in Kibago.
Arrests: Police arrest 39 in Gitega, seize weapons.

The son of Pierre-Claver Mbonimpa, a celebrate human rights activist, was assassinated when unknown assailants threw a grenade in his car in front of his home. Two other bodies uncovered in Ngarara neighbourhoods on Oct 9.
Security measures: Police search a school in Ngagara.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

column17: Protests in support of the ruling party in Bujumbura.
6 abducted by armed group in Gihanga.
Security measures: Searches in Nyakabiga.
Decomposing body found in Cibitoke.
6 injured when kids played with a grenade and it exploded on Marembo hill in Kirundo.

Human rights activist physically assaulted near his home in Kibago.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: MSD activist injured in face after being beaten by Imbonerakure in Musenyi.
Body found in Mwambutsa area of Ngarara.
Rioters throw stones at the house an UPRONA leader in Rubimba hill town in Kibago.

In retaliation for the earlier kidnapping of 3 police officers by ""insurgents"", police began shooting at houses in Ngagara. They killed a local state broadcaster cameraman and then executed his wife, nephew, two teenage children, and a local guard in the main street, according to multiple witnesses. Police shot randomly at houses and intentionally executed 3 more during the operation
Security measures: Searches in Nyakabiga.

""Insurgents"" abducted 3 policemen while searches were being conducted in Ntahangwa area of Ngagara, which led to clashes with police. 2 policemen were killed, while 9 people, including a RTNB journalist and his family and a staff member from the International Organization for Migration, were killed by the police. Residents claim 7 civilians were ""executed"".
Two attacks on police station in Kinanira area of Musaga. Several dead and injured.
Grenade launched in Kabondo. One vehicle damaged.
Woman abducted in Bwiza, found dead the next day.
Intelligence officer injures civilians with a bayonet.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Security agents shoot and injure man while pulling him from his car.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Security measures: Security agents search Coalition of Hope (Amizero yAbarundi) homes in Muriza.
Woman kidnapped and found the next day strangled to death. 4 suspects arrested.
Rioters burn a bridge in Mutakura in revenge for police use of the bridge. Reports that police arrested and killed one rioter.
""One national staff member was killed along with eight other civilians after being shot at close range in Bujumbura.""
